reviewText: Videoland's greatest guru John St. Clair (Paul Kolsby) meets movie marketeer Denise M. Hunter(Sharon Repass) after twenty years at the store and lamely asks her out with proding from clerk Vinny (Alan Natale). Feeling a need to better himself he gets a low level office job that turns into making automated video stores and they want him to get Videoland from Henry Hrundi (Pramod Mishrekar)... (Laser Blazer 10587 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90064 where the producer Ana Barredo worked at in college and counter scenes plus at "Sound Stage 21" - the garage of producer Henry Rivas, - fun informative commentary)  - from "Ghek Remembers Video Stores and their Employees in movies"

I saw this film at the 2001 Ashland Independent Film Festival.  The film is a witty and insightful look at love, careers and the video business!
Though it appears to have been shot on a shoestring, the filmmakers made up for their lack of budget with an engaging plot and very funny dialog.
Highly recommended!
